comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.live.com%2Fmail%2F0%2F) ### Comment > It "pretends" to be an email. Hovering the mouse on it shows a trash can, which deletes the ad until the next time I access Outlook Web. > > Every default filter is enabled (Base filter, Annoyances filter etc.). The ad appears both in Chrome and Edge. > > I don't use Firefox much, but I've just tested it and the ad was NOT appearing, until I clicked the update filters icon in Adguard. I've always had Firefox installed, but since I don't use it much, I believe the filters were outdated. Updating them seems to somehow have allowed this Outlook ad. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/30d3koB.jpg)

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

You can try to check this rule:
```adblock
startv.com.tr,showtv.com.tr#%#//scriptlet('m3u-prune', '/daioncdn\.net\/.*\/ad\//', '/daioncdn\.net\/.*\.m3u8/')
```
It seems that it works fine on my end, but I'm not sure, because it looks like these ads appear after some time.
I checked out only 2 domains (`startv.com.tr`, `showtv.com.tr`), but I suppose that it should works on other domains as well.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://google.com/search](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fgoogle.com%2Fsearch) ### Comment > I discovered today that if I search for certain content, I end up with a blank page. The search results will briefly flash on the screen before the page goes blank. After doing a bunch of random searches, it seems this is only an issue when searching for TV shows or movies. If I search for a person, place or thing, I have not had any issues. When Adguard is off, I have no issues. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/e4kLTtT.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/3421g1l.jpg)

EasyList

Security:

comment.body: @Alex-302: checked, no filter enables functionality. Over the weekend I checked other options in AdGuard and it seems, that by disabling _Automatically filter applications_ either completely or just for Safari, solves the issue (see screenshots) Interestingly, when having this still enabled for Chrome (see second screenshot), Chrome can follow links on Google normally.

comment.body:
"AdGuard app or extension" is detected, the other things are not – which is correct, the other things are not enabled.

I just re-tried and the issue still occurs. If I switch content blocker off for that site, it loads fine. With it enabled, I get the ad blocker popover. It happens on both of my iOS devices, iPhone 14 Pro and iPad Air 4.

Okay, so as far I understand, ads are blocked correctly, but the only problem is that, if there is a pause for advertisements (there is no content, just the advert splash screen is displayed), then video is buffering/loading until the advertisement is finished.
If so, then I think that it's not a problem and I will add this rule, also to block `daioncdn.net/events`.

Thank you for checking it out.
